[GRAMMAR]: Incorrect verb tense ("shoulded"), subject-verb agreement ("desks should faced"), and pronoun usage ("which" instead of "that").
[LEXICON]: Archaic phrasing ("force to stop over", "give much time") and awkward word choices ("boxes" for equipment).
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "It was quite evident...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from anecdotes to "GETTING A POSITION" without clear linking.
[STRUCTURE]: Tangential example about the principal’s personality (relevant but loosely integrated).
[LOGIC]: Minor repetition in contrasting "job" vs. "profession" without explicit thematic connection to preceding advice.

[LEXICON]: Word choice ("extreme" attire could be more precise)

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition between paragraphs (e.g., promotion anecdote)
[TRANSITION]: Lack of explicit links between examples (e.g., young woman’s specialization)
[CLARITY]: Repetitive emphasis on qualifications without clear progression
